others: not a four-limbed primate or electronic device
not black, grey, white, brown, or red-brown, or rectangular in shape
lacks a wet nose, curved nostrils, long tail, large eyes, furry body, clawed hands and feet, or a screen
does not have a stand or mount, speakers, power cord, input ports, or remote control
may have unique characteristics depending on the specific object or subject
nuclei in cells: typically spherical or oval in shape
usually the largest organelle in a cell
located in the center of the cell
surrounded by a double membrane called the nuclear envelope
contains genetic material (DNA) in the form of chromatin
may appear darker or more dense than the surrounding cytoplasm
can be distinguished from other organelles by its size, shape, and staining properties
